intro: Fagara echinocarpa, commonly known as the spiny fruit fagara, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree that typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with opposite arrangement and small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale green. Its fruit is a berry that becomes woody and spiny as it matures, giving it its common name. The plant has some traditional medicinal uses among indigenous communities.
